author: daxian-dbw
body:
## Steps to reproduce

Import-Module -n[tab]
## Expected behavior

`-n` should be expanded to `-Name`
## Actual behavior

Auto completion doesn't happen
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
GitCommitId                    v0.6.0-2-gbb32a9648bd5bf0d15e8f903430d9cebc2331d28-dirty
PSEdition                      Core

CLRVersion

SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
WSManStackVersion              3.0

> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.10032.0
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}

GitCommitId                    v0.6.0-6-gca1780255ffeb96b9f82ed3068476d85836...
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1


## 14387.1000.amd64fre.rs1_srv_ps_dev.160711-1500
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----

PSEdition                      Desktop

CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
```

title: Import-Module -n<tab> doesn't work in both Full PS and Core PS, including the SD build
